chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michelle Lee Devalk

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michelle Lee Devalk not in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke appeared by video for Michelle Lee Devalk.  Attorney Jessica Ann Behling appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Parties are still negotiating and requesting a status conference.  Case is adjourned to 11-8-22 at 9:00 am for status conference by zoom. 
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Michelle Lee Devalk appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke appeared by video for Michelle Lee Devalk.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 10, Judge Havas. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 10.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michelle Lee Devalk not in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court for Michelle Lee Devalk.  Prosecuting attorney Michelle A. Grasso in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Lamke is now the attorney of record.  Case is adjourned to 9-8-22 at 1:30 for preliminary hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michelle Lee Devalk not in court, defendant in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Preliminary Hearing.  Public defenders office has not appointed counsel on this case.  Court finds GOOD CAUSE to preliminary hearing time limits.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Michelle Lee Devalk in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Michelle Lee Devalk in custody.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michelle Lee Devalk appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, CPAU No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CH (01/25/2021)
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
